positions.author: Unknown
positions.quote: Man, Spinoza held, is a part of Nature, and Nature is governed by eternal and immutable laws.

positions.author: Unknown
positions.quote: The central controlling idea of Spinozas philosophy is that all things are necessarily determined in Nature, which he conceives to be an absolutely infinite unified and uniform order.

positions.author: Unknown
positions.quote: The truth, he devoutly believed, would make us free.

positions.author: Unknown
positions.quote: THE PHILOSOPHY OF SPINOZA edited by JOSEPH RATNER.

positions.author: Unknown
positions.quote: Spinozas belief in the self-sufficing, lawful order of Nature, and the adequacy of the natural powers of our mind to understand the mysteries of heaven and earth, the singular expository style of the Ethics emphasizes in unmistakable fashion.

positions.author: Unknown
positions.quote: Spinoza lived the ethics he wrote.

positions.author: Unknown
positions.quote: He was content to search for the truth and to explain what he found as best he could.

positions.author: Unknown
positions.quote: The object in taking the Ethics as much as possible out of the geometrical form, was not to improve upon the author's text; it was to give the lay reader a text of Spinoza he would find pleasanter to read and easier to understand.

positions.author: Unknown
positions.quote: Spinozas philosophy has suffered not a little from the highly abstruse and technical form in which the Ethics is written.

positions.author: Unknown
positions.quote: Spinozas courage and strength of mind are as impressively manifested in the constant daily life he lived as in the few severe crises he resolutely faced.

positions.author: Unknown
positions.quote: A continuous reading of the original Ethics, even on a single topic, is impossible.

positions.author: Unknown
positions.quote: Every care has been taken not to distort in any way the meaning of the text.

positions.author: Unknown
positions.quote: It is the only time, probably, dismembering a treatise actually made it more unified.
